document_data.name: Ansril Ammhaddan
document_data.mainbody: High Songmaster '''Ansril Ammhaddan''' was the high priest of the [[House of Song (Selgaunt)|House of Song]], a temple dedicated to [[Milil]], in [[Selgaunt]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Activities: ''Circa'' [[1358 DR]], Ansril was the leader of Milil's faithful in Selgaunt. His congregation within the temple consisted of 24 other priests and 49 followers. Ansril was a [[specialty priest]] of Milil called a [[tuneservant]].
document_data.History: On [[Uktar 29]] of the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, during the [[Sembian Civil War]], Prince [[Rivalen Tanthul]] summoned a contingent of Sharran priests to help in the upcoming [[Battle of Selgaunt]]. However, Ansril together with [[Aumraeya Ulmdrin]] and the city's high priests of [[Deneir]], [[Oghma]], [[Lliira]], [[Lathander]], [[Tymora]], and [[Waukeen]] protested this to the [[hulorn]] [[Thamalon Uskevren II]], but he rebuffed them with an accusation of cowardice.
